contentList.content: Unlock 4th Level Spell Slots
You can now cast 4th level spells.
Unlock 5th Level Spell Slots
You can now cast 5th level spells.
Unlock 7th Level Spell Slots
You can now cast 7th level spells.
Unlock 8th Level Spell Slots
You can now cast 8th level spells.
Unlock 9th Level Spell Slots
You can now cast 9th level spells.
Studied Attacks
If you miss a creature with an attack roll, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.
Extra Attack (3)
You can attack four times whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
Improved Brutal Strike

You have honed new ways to attack furiously. The following effects are now among your Brutal Strike options: <LSTag Type="ItemPassive" Tooltip="haa11111111111111111111111111b014">Staggering Blow</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="ItemPassive" Tooltip="haa11111111111111111111111111b018">Sundering Blow</LSTag>.
Improved Brutal Strike (17th Level)
The extra damage of your Brutal Strike increases to <LSTag Tooltip="DealDamage">2d10</LSTag>. In addition, you can use two different Brutal Strike effects whenever you use your Brutal Strike feature.
Indomitable Might

If your total for a Strength check or Strength saving throw is less than your Strength score, you can use that score in place of the total. Your minimum roll on Athletics checks and Strength saving throws is 24.
Primal Champion
You embody primal power. Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 4, to a maximum of 25.
Deflect Energy
You can now use Deflect Missiles to deflect energy-based ranged attacks, such as fire bolts or lightning.
Perfect Focus
When you roll Initiative and have fewer than 4 Ki Points, you regain Ki Points until you have 4.
Superior Defense
Spend 3 Ki Points to gain resistance to all damage except Force for 1 minute.
Body and Mind
Your Dexterity and Wisdom scores increase by 4, to a maximum of 26.
Subtle Strikes
You can use Sneak Attack even if no ally is within 5 feet of your target, as long as the target has no allies within 5 feet of it.
Elusive
No attack roll can have Advantage against you unless you are Incapacitated.
Stroke of Luck
Once per Short Rest, you can turn a missed attack into a hit, or treat a failed ability check as a 20.
Cleansing Touch
You can use your action to end one spell on yourself or on one willing creature that you touch. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier.
Aura Expansion (30 ft)
Your paladin auras now extend to 30 feet instead of 10 feet.
Aura of Protection (10 ft)
You and friendly creatures within 10 feet gain a bonus to saving throws equal to your Charisma modifier.
Relentless Hunter
You gain a bonus to Initiative rolls and cannot be surprised while conscious.
Feral Senses
You can see invisible creatures within 30 feet of you.
Foe Slayer
Once per turn, you can add your Wisdom modifier to the attack roll or damage roll against a favored enemy.
Spell Mastery
Choose a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell. You can cast these spells at will without expending spell slots.
Signature Spells
Choose two 3rd-level spells. These are always prepared and you can cast each once per Long Rest without expending a spell slot.
Greater Divine Intervention
Your Divine Intervention automatically succeeds. After using it, you cannot use it again until you finish 2d4 Long Rests.
Beast Spells
You can cast spells while in Wild Shape form, as long as the spell does not require material components.
Archdruid
You can use Wild Shape an unlimited number of times.
Superior Inspiration
When you roll Initiative and have no Bardic Inspiration dice remaining, you regain one use.
Words of Creation

You have mastered two of the Words of Creation: the words of life and death. You always have <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_PowerWordHeal_WordsOfCreation">Power Word Heal</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_PowerWordKill_WordsOfCreation">Power Word Kill</LSTag> prepared. When you cast either spell, you can target a second creature if it is within 10 feet of the first target.
Arcane Apotheosis
When you have no spell slots remaining, you can spend Sorcery Points to cast spells (points equal to the spell level).
Mystic Arcanum (7th)
Choose a 7th-level warlock spell. You can cast it once per Long Rest without expending a spell slot.
Mystic Arcanum (8th)
Choose an 8th-level warlock spell. You can cast it once per Long Rest without expending a spell slot.
Mystic Arcanum (9th)
Choose a 9th-level warlock spell. You can cast it once per Long Rest without expending a spell slot.
Eldritch Master
Once per Long Rest, you can spend 1 minute entreating your patron to regain all your expended Pact Magic spell slots.
Magic Item Savant
You can attune to up to 4 magic items at once. You ignore class, race, and level requirements on magic items.
Magic Item Master
You can attune to up to 5 magic items at once.
Soul of Artifice
You gain +1 to all saving throws for each magic item you are attuned to. If reduced to 0 HP, you can end one infusion to drop to 1 HP instead.
Lightning Reload
You can reload a firearm as a free action.
Vicious Intent
Your critical hit range with firearms is expanded to 19-20.
Hemorrhaging Critical
When you score a critical hit with a firearm, the target begins bleeding and takes additional damage at the start of each turn.
Infernal Conduit
Your connection to the Hells deepens. Your seals become more powerful and deal additional damage.
Prince of Hell
You have become a true lord of the Nine Hells. Your infernal powers reach their apex.
Mind Over Matter
Your mental fortitude protects your body. You gain resistance to psychic damage and advantage on saves against being charmed or frightened.
Psychic Mastery
Your psionic powers are greatly enhanced. Your psionic abilities deal additional damage and have improved effects.
Supreme Consciousness
You achieve the pinnacle of psychic power. Your mind transcends mortal limitations.
Survivor
At the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier if you have no more than half your hit points remaining.
Improved War Magic
When you use your action to cast a spell, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.
Relentless
When you roll Initiative and have no Superiority Dice remaining, you regain one Superiority Die.
Telekinetic Master
You can cast Telekinesis once per Long Rest without expending a spell slot or requiring concentration.
Inspiring Surge (Improved)
Your Inspiring Surge now allows two allies to make a weapon attack as a reaction.
Runic Juggernaut
When using Giants Might, you become Huge and deal an extra 1d10 damage with weapon attacks.
Versatile Trickster
You can use your Mage Hand to distract creatures, granting you Advantage on attack rolls against them.
Infiltration Expertise
You can create a false identity, complete with documentation, over the course of seven days.
Psychic Veil
As an action, you can become invisible for 1 hour or until you deal damage or force a creature to make a saving throw.
Use Magic Device
You ignore all class, race, and level requirements on the use of magic items.
Murderous Intent
Your sneak attacks become more deadly, channeling dark power from the Dead Three.
Unholy Infiltration
Your connection to the Dead Three grants you supernatural infiltration abilities.
Leading Evasion
When you are subjected to an effect that allows a Dexterity save for half damage, allies within 5 feet also benefit from your Evasion.
Unbreakable Majesty
As a bonus action, assume a majestic presence. For 1 minute, enemies must succeed on a Charisma save to attack you.
Controlled Chaos
When you roll on the Wild Magic Surge table, you can roll twice and use either result.
Tamed Surge
You gain advantage on checks to control Wild Magic effects.
Dragon Wings
You can sprout draconic wings, gaining a flying speed equal to your walking speed.
Dragon Companion
You can summon a draconic spirit to aid you in battle.
Clockwork Cavalcade
You can summon a cavalcade of clockwork creatures to restore order around you.
Revelation in Flesh
You can transform your body, gaining see invisibility, a fly speed, swim speed, or the ability to squeeze through small spaces.
Warping Implosion
You can teleport and force creatures near your departure point to make a save or be pulled toward the space you left.
Crown of Spellfire
You can create a crown of spellfire, gaining ultimate control over magical flames.
Battering Roots: Topple
Your weapon attacks can knock enemies prone.
Battering Roots: Push
Your weapon attacks can push enemies away.
Spell Resistance
You have advantage on saving throws against spells and resistance to spell damage.
Splintered Summons
When your concentration on a conjuration spell is broken, the summoned creatures persist for one additional round.
Greater Portent
You roll three Portent dice instead of two.
Split Enchantment
When you cast an enchantment spell that targets only one creature, you can have it target a second creature.
Alter Memories
When you cast an enchantment spell, you can make one creature forget it was charmed by you.
Overchannel
When you cast a spell of 5th level or lower, you can deal maximum damage. If you use this again before a Long Rest, you take necrotic damage.
Illusory Reality
When you cast an illusion spell, you can make one object in the illusion real for 1 minute.
Deaths Master
Undead you create with necromancy spells have additional hit points and deal extra damage.
Master Transmuter
You can consume your Transmuters Stone to produce a powerful effect: restore youth, raise dead, or transform into another creature.
Bewitching Magic
Your charm magic is enhanced. When you cast an enchantment or illusion spell, you can add your Charisma modifier to the save DC.
Searing Vengeance
When you are reduced to 0 HP, you can instead drop to half your HP and deal radiant damage to nearby enemies.
Hurl Through Hell
When you hit a creature with an attack, you can banish it through the Nine Hells, dealing 10d10 psychic damage.
Create Thrall
You can touch an incapacitated humanoid to charm it indefinitely, creating a telepathic link.
Divine Foreknowledge
As a reaction, you can grant yourself or an ally advantage on an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check.
Supreme Healing
When you roll dice to restore hit points with a spell, you instead use the maximum possible result.
Corona of Light
You emit bright light in a 60-foot radius. Enemies in this light have disadvantage on saves against fire and radiant damage.
Improved Duplicity
You can create four duplicates instead of one, and you can teleport to swap places with any duplicate.
Avatar of Battle
You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons.
Natures Sanctuary
Beasts and plants must make a Wisdom save to attack you. On a failure, they must choose a different target.
Lunar Form
Your Wild Shape forms are enhanced based on the current moon phase.
Oceanic Gift
You can grant allies the ability to breathe underwater and a swim speed for 1 hour.
Full of Stars
While in Starry Form, you become partially incorporeal, gaining resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
Elemental Epitome
You have achieved mastery over the elements. Your elemental disciplines are more powerful and cost fewer Ki Points.
Hand of Ultimate Mercy
You can spend 5 Ki Points to revive a creature that has died within the last 24 hours.
Quivering Palm
You set up vibrations in a creatures body. You can use an action to end the vibrations, forcing the target to make a Constitution save or be reduced to 0 HP.
Cloak of Shadows
When in dim light or darkness, you can become invisible as an action.
Smite of Protection
When you use Divine Smite, allies within 30 feet gain temporary hit points.
Holy Nimbus
You emit an aura of sunlight. Enemies that start their turn in the aura take radiant damage.
Glorious Defense
When a creature you can see hits an ally with an attack, you can add your Charisma modifier to the allys AC and make an attack against the attacker.
Living Legend
You gain advantage on Charisma checks, and once per turn when you miss an attack, you can cause it to hit instead.
Undying Sentinel
When you are reduced to 0 HP, you can choose to drop to 1 HP instead. Once used, you cannot use this again until you finish a Long Rest.
Elder Champion
You transform into an avatar of nature. You regain 10 HP at the start of each turn and can cast spells as a bonus action.
Elemental Rebuke
When a creature hits you with an attack, you can deal elemental damage to it as a reaction.
Noble Scion
You transform into a noble genie, gaining powerful elemental abilities.
Soul of Vengeance
When a creature under your Vow of Enmity attacks, you can make a weapon attack against it as a reaction.
Avenging Angel
You sprout spectral wings and emit a frightening aura. Enemies within 30 feet must succeed on a Wisdom save or be frightened.
Share Spells
When you cast a spell that targets only yourself, you can also affect your beast companion.
Misty Wanderer
You can cast Misty Step without expending a spell slot once per Long Rest. When you do, you can bring a willing ally with you.
Shadowy Dodge
When a creature makes an attack against you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack.
Superior Hunters Defense
Choose one: Evasion, Stand Against the Tide, or Uncanny Dodge.
Frozen Haunt
Your cold abilities are enhanced, leaving foes frozen in supernatural ice.
Chemical Mastery
You gain resistance to acid and poison damage. You can cast Greater Restoration and Heal without expending a spell slot once per Long Rest.
Perfected Armor
Your Arcane Armor gains additional benefits based on its model.
Fortified Position
Creatures gain half cover while within 10 feet of your Eldritch Cannon. You can have two cannons active at once.
Improved Defender
Your Steel Defender gains +2 AC and its attacks deal an extra 2d6 force damage.
Focused Shot
When you take the Attack action, you can forgo one attack to gain advantage on your next attack this turn.
Double or Nothing
When you make an attack, you can choose to roll twice. If both hit, deal double damage. If either misses, you deal no damage.
License to Kill
Once per turn, when you hit a surprised creature, you deal extra damage equal to your Gunslinger level.
Magic Bullet
Your firearm attacks count as magical and can deliver touch spells at range.
Pinball Shot
When you hit a creature, you can ricochet to hit another creature within 10 feet.
Gold Star Hero
Allies within 30 feet of you gain a bonus to saving throws equal to your Charisma modifier.
Vile Transmogrification
You can transform a sealed creature into a lemure under your control.
Hell Mage
You can cast Fireball and Wall of Fire at will.
Quid Pro Quo
When a creature fails a saving throw against your spell, you regain hit points.
Incontrovertible
Your arguments become supernaturally compelling. You have advantage on all Charisma checks and can cast Suggestion at will.
Deathstrike
Once per turn, when you hit a creature with seals, you can force it to make a Constitution save or take maximum damage.
Dispaters Supremacy
You channel the Iron Dukes power. You gain resistance to all damage except radiant.
Haemal Exchange
When you deal damage with a seal, you can sacrifice HP to deal that much extra damage.
Blood for Blood
When a creature damages you, you can use your reaction to deal necrotic damage equal to the damage taken.
Doomed to the Shadows
You can cast Darkness at will and can see through magical darkness.
Dark Malediction
Creatures you seal take ongoing necrotic damage at the start of each of their turns.
Scramble Minds
You can force multiple creatures to make Intelligence saves or be confused for 1 minute.
Heightened Telekinesis
Your telekinetic powers can affect Huge or larger creatures and deal additional force damage.
Psi Warper Feature
Your space-bending abilities allow you to teleport as a bonus action and bring allies with you.
Life-Bending Weapons
You can transform your limbs into deadly psionic weapons that deal 2d10 force damage.
Disciplined Survivor
Your training allows you to succeed on Death Saving Throws on a roll of 5 or higher.
Slippery Mind
Your mental agility has sharpened. You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws.
Improved Blessed Strikes
Your divine strikes deal an additional 2d8 radiant damage instead of 1d8.
Improved Elemental Fury
Your elemental attacks deal an additional 2d8 damage of the same type instead of 1d8.
Staggered
Staggered by a brutal blow. Has Disadvantage on the next saving throw and cannot make Opportunity Attacks until the start of the attacker's next turn.
Cannot make Opportunity Attacks.
Sundered
Armor has been sundered. The next attack against this creature gains a +[1] bonus to the attack roll.
Forceful Blow
Forgo Advantage to deal an extra <LSTag Tooltip="DealDamage">1d10</LSTag> damage, push the target 15 feet away, and move up to half your Speed toward them without provoking Opportunity Attacks.
Forgo Advantage to deal an extra <LSTag Tooltip="DealDamage">2d10</LSTag> damage, push the target 15 feet away, and move up to half your Speed toward them without provoking Opportunity Attacks.
Push Distance: [1]
Hamstring Blow
Forgo Advantage to deal an extra <LSTag Tooltip="DealDamage">1d10</LSTag> damage and reduce the target's Speed by 15 feet until the start of your next turn.
Forgo Advantage to deal an extra <LSTag Tooltip="DealDamage">2d10</LSTag> damage and reduce the target's Speed by 15 feet until the start of your next turn.
Speed Reduction: [1]
Staggering Blow

Forgo Advantage to deal an extra <LSTag Tooltip="DealDamage">1d10</LSTag> damage. The target has Disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes, and cannot make Opportunity Attacks until the start of your next turn.

Forgo Advantage to deal an extra <LSTag Tooltip="DealDamage">2d10</LSTag> damage. The target has Disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes, and cannot make Opportunity Attacks until the start of your next turn.
Inflicts: Disadvantage on next save, Cannot make Opportunity Attacks
Sundering Blow

Forgo Advantage to deal an extra <LSTag Tooltip="DealDamage">1d10</LSTag> damage. Before the start of your next turn, the next attack roll made by another creature against the target gains a +5 bonus.

Forgo Advantage to deal an extra <LSTag Tooltip="DealDamage">2d10</LSTag> damage. Before the start of your next turn, the next attack roll made by another creature against the target gains a +5 bonus.
Next ally attack gains: +5 attack bonus
Forceful Hamstring
Forgo Advantage to deal an extra <LSTag Tooltip="DealDamage">2d10</LSTag> damage, push the target 15 feet away, move toward them, AND reduce their Speed by 15 feet.
Forceful Stagger

Forgo Advantage to deal an extra <LSTag Tooltip="DealDamage">2d10</LSTag> damage, push the target 15 feet away, move toward them, AND inflict Disadvantage on their next save while preventing Opportunity Attacks.
Forceful Sunder
Forgo Advantage to deal an extra <LSTag Tooltip="DealDamage">2d10</LSTag> damage, push the target 15 feet away, move toward them, AND grant the next attack against them a +5 bonus.
Crippling Stagger

Forgo Advantage to deal an extra <LSTag Tooltip="DealDamage">2d10</LSTag> damage, reduce the target's Speed by 15 feet, AND inflict Disadvantage on their next save while preventing Opportunity Attacks.
Crippling Sunder
Forgo Advantage to deal an extra <LSTag Tooltip="DealDamage">2d10</LSTag> damage, reduce the target's Speed by 15 feet, AND grant the next attack against them a +5 bonus.
Staggering Sunder

Forgo Advantage to deal an extra <LSTag Tooltip="DealDamage">2d10</LSTag> damage, inflict Disadvantage on their next save, prevent Opportunity Attacks, AND grant the next attack against them a +5 bonus.
Intimidating Presence

As a Bonus Action, strike terror into others. Each creature of your choice in a 30-foot Emanation must make a Wisdom saving throw or be Frightened for 1 minute. Once used, regain by finishing a Long Rest or expending a Rage use.
Power of the Wilds: Falcon
While your Rage is active, you have a Fly Speed equal to your Speed if you aren't wearing any armor.
Power of the Wilds: Lion
While your Rage is active, any of your enemies within 5 feet of you have Disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you.
Power of the Wilds: Ram
While your Rage is active, you can cause a Large or smaller creature to have the Prone condition when you hit it with a melee attack.
Falcon Spirit
You have a Fly Speed equal to your Speed while your Rage is active.
Lion Spirit
Enemies within 5 feet have Disadvantage on attacks against targets other than you.
Lion's Menace
Disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than the Lion Barbarian.
Travel along the Tree
When you activate your Rage and as a Bonus Action while your Rage is active, you can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
Travel along the Tree
Teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
Travel along the Tree
As a Bonus Action while Rage is active, teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
World Tree Connection
You can use Travel along the Tree as a Bonus Action while your Rage is active.
Rage of the Gods
When you activate your Rage, you can assume the form of a divine warrior for 1 minute. You gain Flight, and Resistance to Necrotic, Psychic, and Radiant damage. Once per Long Rest.
Rage of the Gods
Assume the form of a divine warrior. Gain Flight and Resistance to Necrotic, Psychic, and Radiant damage while your Rage is active.
Divine Warrior
You have assumed the form of a divine warrior. You have Flight and Resistance to Necrotic, Psychic, and Radiant damage.
Living Havok
When you enter your Rage, you roll on the Wild Magic table twice and also trigger a random effect from an enhanced Living Havok table, gaining two magical effects instead of one.
Force Explosion

Wild magic erupts from you in a concussive blast. Enemies within <LSTag Tooltip="Distance" Type="Distance">3m</LSTag> must make a Constitution saving throw or take <LSTag Tooltip="DealDamage">3d6 Force</LSTag> damage and become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DAZED">Dazed</LSTag> for 2 turns.
Surge of Action
Wild magic infuses you with incredible speed, granting you an additional Action this turn.
Twin Mephit Manifestation
Wild magic tears open small rifts, summoning two Mephits to fight by your side.
Temporal Acceleration
Wild magic warps time around you, granting you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="HASTE">Haste</LSTag> for 5 turns.
Darkness Shroud
An aura of magical darkness envelops you, moving with you for the duration of your Rage. Creatures within 5m are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="HEAVILY_OBSCURED">Heavily Obscured</LSTag>.
Darkness Shroud
Surrounded by an aura of magical darkness that moves with you. Creatures within 5m are Heavily Obscured.
Frozen Vortex

A swirling vortex of ice and hail surrounds you for 5 turns. Enemies within <LSTag Tooltip="Distance" Type="Distance">6m</LSTag> take <LSTag Tooltip="DealDamage">2d8 Cold</LSTag> + <LSTag Tooltip="DealDamage">2d8 Bludgeoning</LSTag> damage.
Frozen Vortex
Surrounded by a vortex of ice and hail. Enemies within 6m take 2d8 Cold + 2d8 Bludgeoning damage.
Frozen Vortex
Caught in a frozen vortex. Taking Cold and Bludgeoning damage.
Surge of Undeath

Necrotic energy pulses from you. Enemies within <LSTag Tooltip="Distance" Type="Distance">6m</LSTag> are marked - if they die within 3 turns, they rise as aggressive Zombies that attack all creatures.
Marked by Undeath
Marked by necrotic energy. If this creature dies, it will rise as an aggressive Zombie.
Lightning Strike
Wild magic discharges as a bolt of lightning toward the nearest enemy, dealing <LSTag Tooltip="DealDamage">8d6 Lightning</LSTag> damage (Dexterity save for half).
Temporal Backlash
The wild magic backfires, warping time against you. You are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SLOW">Slowed</LSTag> for 3 turns.
Power Word Kill
You speak a word of power that can compel one creature you can see to die instantly. If the creature has 100 hit points or fewer, it dies. Otherwise, the spell has no effect.
Power Word Heal

A wave of healing energy washes over a creature you can see. The target regains all its hit points. If the creature is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYZED">Paralyzed</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STUNNED">Stunned</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blinded</LSTag>, or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DISEASED">Diseased</LSTag>, the condition ends.
Power Word Kill: Words of Creation

Speaking a word of death, you can compel up to two creatures within 10 feet of each other to die instantly. If a creature has 100 hit points or fewer, it dies. Otherwise, the spell has no effect on that creature.
Power Word Heal: Words of Creation

Speaking a word of life, a wave of healing energy washes over up to two creatures within 10 feet of each other. Each target regains all its hit points, and any <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYZED">Paralyzed</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STUNNED">Stunned</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blinded</LSTag>, or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DISEASED">Diseased</LSTag> conditions end.
Power Word Heal
A wave of healing energy washes over a creature you can see. The target regains all its hit points (up to 700). If the creature is Charmed, Frightened, Paralyzed, or Stunned, the condition ends.
Wish
The mightiest spell a mortal creature can cast. Simply by speaking aloud, you can alter reality itself.
True Polymorph
Transform a creature into another creature or object. The transformation lasts until dispelled or the creature drops to 0 hit points.
Meteor Swarm

Blazing orbs of fire plummet to the ground at four different points you can see, creating massive explosions. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 20d6 fire damage and 20d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
Gate
You conjure a portal linking an unoccupied space you can see to a precise location on a different plane of existence.
Foresight

You touch a willing creature and bestow a limited ability to see into the immediate future. For the duration, the target can't be surprised and has advantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. Other creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against it.
Time Stop

You briefly stop the flow of time for everyone but yourself. You take 1d4+1 turns in a row, during which you can use actions and move as normal. This spell ends if you affect any creature other than yourself or an object being worn or carried by someone other than you.
Mass Heal

A flood of healing energy flows from you into injured creatures around you. You restore up to 700 hit points, divided as you choose among any number of creatures that you can see within range. Creatures healed are also cured of diseases and any effect making them blinded or deafened.
Prismatic Wall
A shimmering, multicolored plane of light forms a vertical opaque wall. Each layer has a different color and effect on creatures that pass through it.
Spell Mastery: Level 1 Selection
Choose a level 1 spell to cast at will.
Spell Mastery: Level 2 Selection
Choose a level 2 spell to cast at will.
Spell Mastery: Selecting Spells
Choose a level 1 and a level 2 spell from your spellbook to cast at will.
Spell Mastery

You have achieved such mastery over certain spells that you can cast them at will. Choose a level 1 and a level 2 spell in your spellbook that have a casting time of an action. You always have those spells prepared, and you can cast them at their lowest level without expending a spell slot. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can study your spellbook and replace one of those spells with an eligible spell of the same level.
Spell Mastery
Open your spellbook to select your mastered spells. Choose one level 1 and one level 2 spell to cast at will without expending spell slots. Your choices reset on Long Rest.
Master: Burning Hands
Select Burning Hands as your mastered level 1 spell. You can cast it at will without expending a spell slot.
Master: Charm Person
Select Charm Person as your mastered level 1 spell. You can cast it at will without expending a spell slot.
Master: Chromatic Orb
Select Chromatic Orb as your mastered level 1 spell. You can cast it at will without expending a spell slot.
Master: Color Spray
Select Color Spray as your mastered level 1 spell. You can cast it at will without expending a spell slot.
Master: Disguise Self
Select Disguise Self as your mastered level 1 spell. You can cast it at will without expending a spell slot.
Master: Expeditious Retreat
Select Expeditious Retreat as your mastered level 1 spell. You can cast it at will without expending a spell slot.
Master: False Life
Select False Life as your mastered level 1 spell. You can cast it at will without expending a spell slot.
Master: Feather Fall
Select Feather Fall as your mastered level 1 spell. You can cast it at will without expending a spell slot.
Master: Find Familiar
Select Find Familiar as your mastered level 1 spell. You can cast it at will without expending a spell slot.
Master: Fog Cloud
Select Fog Cloud as your mastered level 1 spell. You can cast it at will without expending a spell slot.
Master: Grease
Select Grease as your mastered level 1 spell. You can cast it at will without expending a spell slot.
Master: Hideous Laughter
Select Tasha's Hideous Laughter as your mastered level 1 spell. You can cast it at will without expending a spell slot.
Master: Jump
Select Jump as your mastered level 1 spell. You can cast it at will without expending a spell slot.
Master: Longstrider
Select Longstrider as your mastered level 1 spell. You can cast it at will without expending a spell slot.
Master: Mage Armor
Select Mage Armor as your mastered level 1 spell. You can cast it at will without expending a spell slot.

Prismatic Spray
Unleash rays of prismatic light in a [1] cone. Choose which elemental ray to release - each creature in the area must make a Dexterity Saving Throw or take [2] damage (half on a successful save).
Prismatic Spray: Fire
Release a red ray of fire in a [1] cone. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity Saving Throw or take [2] damage (half on a successful save).
Prismatic Spray: Acid
Release an orange ray of acid in a [1] cone. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity Saving Throw or take [2] damage (half on a successful save).
Prismatic Spray: Lightning
Release a yellow ray of lightning in a [1] cone. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity Saving Throw or take [2] damage (half on a successful save).
Prismatic Spray: Poison
Release a green ray of poison in a [1] cone. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity Saving Throw or take [2] damage (half on a successful save).
Prismatic Spray: Cold
Release a blue ray of cold in a [1] cone. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity Saving Throw or take [2] damage (half on a successful save).
Regenerate
Touch a creature to restore [1] Hit Points. For 1 hour, the target regains [2] at the start of each of its turns.
Regenerating [1] at the start of each turn.
Resurrection
Return a dead creature to life with 1 Hit Point. The creature must have died within the last century.
Project Image
Create an illusory duplicate of yourself at any location within range. You can see and hear through the duplicate and cast spells as if you were in its space. Requires Concentration.
Projecting an illusory image. Advantage on Deception and Performance checks.
Power Word Stun

Speak a word of power that can overwhelm the mind of one creature you can see. If the target has [1] Hit Points or fewer, it is <LSTag Tooltip="STUNNED">Stunned</LSTag>. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution Saving Throw to end this effect.
Glibness

For 1 hour, when you make a Charisma check, you can replace the number you roll with a 15. Additionally, no matter what you say, magic that would determine if you are telling the truth indicates you are being truthful.
Charisma checks cannot roll below 15. Cannot be detected as lying by magic.
Feeblemind

Blast a creature's mind, dealing [1] and shattering its intellect. On a failed Intelligence Saving Throw, the target's Intelligence and Charisma scores become 1. The creature can't cast spells, activate magic items, or communicate until cured.
Intelligence and Charisma reduced to 1. Cannot cast spells or communicate effectively.
Foresight

Touch a willing creature and grant it limited ability to see into the immediate future. For 8 hours, the target has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Attack Rolls, Ability Checks, and Saving Throws. Other creatures have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on Attack Rolls against it.
Limited foresight grants Advantage on all d20 rolls. Attackers have Disadvantage.
True Polymorph
Transform a creature or object into a different creature or object. If you concentrate on this spell for the full duration, the transformation becomes permanent.
Transformed into another form.
